reviewText: Finally nice to see a Steppenwolf DVD -- albeit not the original Wolf. DVD is great quality picture and sound -- not all of the old Steppenwolf hits but a great representation. John Kay still sounds awesome. DVD has some extra nuggets including interviews with each band member backstage -- but the lead guitarist interviewed in the extras section is not the guitarist playing live -- not certain what the story is there. All in all tho -- I great DVD for Rock n Roll DVD collectors -- especially the 2004 rendition of 'Monster'.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow.....John Kay is a class act. He's mellowed with time but hasn't lost a step as a rock and roller. I loved the interviews with John and his band mates....they have allot of respect for him, and as one of them mentioned, it's not the John Kay show with a back up band.....they are a true band and they're all make up Steppenwolf. I enjoyed all the extras (watch that Last Wolf Fest sampler......wow, this is a band who loves and respects their fans as much as their listeners love them......very cool). Most aging rockers embarrass themselves 30 years later.......Kay and company deliver the goods here, and the Steppenwolf songs have surprisingly stood the test of time well. Kay has no ego and is a gentle, thinking man.....a great package of music, and the extras help us really understand these guys. A really terrific package.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A real goodie for those who crave some Howling!  John Kay is the leader of this pack, and in my opinion a powerful performer.  Naturally Monster,Magic Carpet Ride and Born to be Wild are expected to be rockin and they are, but the added perk is that the other selections are equally delicious.  I may be charmed by this Wolf in hunks clothing, but it makes for a nice visual along with sounds that take you back to the days when carpet rides were truly carefree.Sad that this year is the bands farewell tour.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great concert and good sound.  John sounds good.  Others have mentioned no bass player - they are correct.  Apparently they have some sophisticated software that lets them coordinate pre-recorded bass and I also noticed some extra percussion (cow bell and wood block).  Don't worry though, the rest is pure live - no lip syncing crap.  When you watch one of the extras on this thing, at their "wolf-fest", they have a 5th band member playing bass.They made the unfortunate mistake of not having a selection for "AUDIO SETUP" like most DVD concerts, but you can still get Dolby 5.1.  Here's how - You have to hit your "Display" or "Setup" selection on your remote that would be available on all things you play.  On my Toshiba DVD player, once the DVD is inserted, I can hit "Play", then I hit my "Display" button that shows all the settings on a bar across the top of the screen.  One of the items is an icon that looks like music notes.  When I use my arrow button to select it, it pops down all possible choices, on this particular DVD it lists Dolby Stereo or Dolby 5.1.  I select Dolby 5.1 and it instantaneously changes.  I then hit my Display button 2 more times to make the menu bar disappear.  I've found on other DVDs, there may be more choices.
summary: Worth buying!  Dolby 5.1 DOES WORK - here's how

reviewText: He still can belt it out and his band is very good. Brings back lots of memories. Worth buying if you like Steppenwolf.....
Title: N/A

reviewText: John Kay hasn't lost a step.....However - the package is misleading.  There is no DD-5.1 - It is a Dolby 2.0 stereo soundtrack only - though an acceptable Dolby -2.0 soundtrack at that. But not what the packaging describes it as. Also, the video is not all that good either.  It looks better on my 36" Toshiba than on my 65" HDTV - but not a good video transfer.  A good compilation of Wolf tracks but I am sorry I purchased it because of the audio/video quality....
summary: John Kay hasn't lost a step.....
Title: N/A

reviewText: Just a quick review of the subject dvd. This concert dvd deserves to be seen by anyone interested in wolf music.Great performance by John and the band.John's voice is still one of the great rock voices of all times.The last half of the dvd is just smoking! And if you thought you could be tired of Born to be wild you have to hear this live version.Absolutely killer! Also great versions of Monster,Ride with me,Snowblind Friend,Carpet Ride and Pusher.Supporting players are tight and do justice to the music.Mix the magaritas,get a tatoo,and play this baby LOUD!!

reviewText: It was like a blast from the past. The video was excelent, the audio was well done also. I enjoyed it.
summary: John Kay's voice hasn't changed at all!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just don't see how John Kay does it. He has as much enthusiasm today as a 60 plus year old man as any 20 year old artist I have ever seen out on the concert circuit, with the possible exception of Dave Mason. Steppenwolf is not just out there resting on past glory either, they play their collective butts off. So if you get a chance to go and see them Live, do yourself a huge favor and go watch them.I am very impressed with the sound quality of this DVD and I watch this concert at least once a week. So, buy it, watch it, enjoy it.Long Live Rock and Roll!!!And as Dave Mason so perfectly stated, Rock and Roll is an Attitude not an Age!

reviewText: Sitting here listening to Snowblind Friend...so nice. This is a fabulous DVD. Sound is pretty great, too. John still has the pipes and sound. Another group that will never replaced.
summary: One of my favorites...THE voice of rock and blues

reviewText: Not having seen the group live while I was growing up I listened to their vintage live album many times in my youth.  Granted, this performance was not done in an arena with 10,000 people, but John Kay and the group still put on a good show.  The special features include interviews with the band that give a new perspective on how special their music was and lives on even now.  The older the rockers get they still can rock with the best.  Perhaps it would be good to have a more recent concert video produced for HD quality, but this DVD is pretty good all things considered.
summary: Steppenwolf in performance still rock the joint
